p: In addition to these egg proteins and peptides, there are increasing data reporting the antimicrobial activity of egg-derived peptides that may be released after partial hydrolysis by exogenous proteases. Such hydrolytic peptides obtained from lysozyme [ 70, 71, 72, 73], from ovotransferrin [ 25], from ovomucin [ 74], and from cystatin [ 75] have shown a broad range of antibacterial activities.
